searchDocs.title: MDX Blog Post
searchDocs.content: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. tip Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

searchDocs.title: Favorite filter
searchDocs.content: Favorite filter When enabled, only vault files that have a favorite property value of true will be displayed. In order for this filter to work, you must choose a property to filter by. You may configure this by updating the favorite property setting.

searchDocs.title: Filter rule types​
searchDocs.content: Name	Descriptionproperty	A property found in the frontmatter of a markdown note folder name	A folder name file name	A file name content	The text found in a markdown note, excluding the frontmatter

searchDocs.title: Property​
searchDocs.content: This rule only applies to markdown files and will not affect any other types of files.  Property filter options​  Name	Descriptionproperty type	The property type. This matches the Obsidian types: text, number, list, checkbox, date, datetime property name	A property name condition	The property condition value	Text to compare match when property doesn't exist	When true, markdown files that don't have the selected property name will be unaffected by this rule  Property filter conditions​  Nameis is not contains does not contain starts with ends with exists does not exist

searchDocs.title: Folder name​
searchDocs.content: Folder name filter options​  Name	Descriptioncondition	The filter condition folder name	A dropdown list of folder names include subfolder	Whether subfolders should be included  Folder name filter conditions​  Nameis is not

searchDocs.title: File name​
searchDocs.content: File name filter options​  Name	Descriptioncondition	The filter condition value	Text to compare  File name filter condition​  Nameis is not contains does not contain starts with ends with

searchDocs.title: Content​
searchDocs.content: Content is the text that appears in a markdown file, excluding the frontmatter.  This rule only applies to markdown files and will not affect any other types of files.  This rule can be used to filter by tags that appear in the body of a markdown note instead of the frontmatter.  This is a premium feature.  Content filter options​  Name	Descriptioncondition	The filter condition value	Text to compare  Content filter condition​  Namecontains does not contain is empty is not empty

searchDocs.title: Sort order
searchDocs.content: Sort order Changes the order of the vault files that are displayed. Name	DescriptionFile name (A-Z)	Sorts based on file name in ascending order File name (Z-A)	Sorts based on file name in descending order Modified time (new to old)	Sorts based on modification date in descending order Modified time (old to new)	Sorts based on modification date in ascending order You may use an Obsidian property instead of the file system time by updating the modification date setting.

searchDocs.title: Timestamp filter
searchDocs.content: Timestamp filter Only displays vault files that match the timestamp filter option. For specific information, see the table below: Name	DescriptionAll	Show all files Modified today	Modification date is between 12:00 am and 11:59 pm today Created today	Creation date is between 12:00 am and 11:59 pm today Modified this week	Modification date is within the last 7 days, starting from 12:00 am today Created this week	Creation date is within the last 7 days, starting from 12:00 am today Modified 2 weeks	Modification date is within the last 14 days, starting from 12:00 am today Created 2 weeks	Creation date is within the last 14 days, starting from 12:00 am today You may use an Obsidian property instead of the file system time by updating the modification date setting or creation date setting.

searchDocs.title: Keyboard navigation
searchDocs.content: Keyboard navigation TODO

searchDocs.title: Make a custom view layout
searchDocs.content: Make a custom view layout This guide will help you to create a custom view layout using the Vault Explorer plugin. TODO

searchDocs.title: Create a property rule​
searchDocs.content: Add a filter groupAdd a filter ruleClick the property type dropdown. Change it from text to listClick the property name dropdown. Change it from select a property to tagsClick the condition dropdown. Change it from contains to your condition of choice.If an input appears, enter in the tag that you want to filter by, without a hash mark #

searchDocs.title: Create a content rule​
searchDocs.content: On the same filter group, add another filter ruleClick the property operator dropdown. Change it from and to orClick the rule type dropdown. Change it from property to contentClick the filter condition dropdown. Change it from contains to your condition of choice.If an input appears, enter in the tag that you want to filter by, without a hash mark #  Now click outside of the modal and enable your filter group.  Congratulations, you are now filtering vault files based on tags found in both the frontmatter or the body of the markdown files.

searchDocs.title: Feed
searchDocs.content: Feed The feed view displays vault files as detailed items in a list. Items include a short display of the file content. This is a premium feature.

searchDocs.title: License​
searchDocs.content: A license gives you lifetime access to premium Vault Explorer features. These include new views and quality of life improvements. Purchasing a license is also a way to support the development of the plugin.  When you purchase a license, you will receive an email with your license key within 24 hours. This email is currently sent manually. After receiving your license key, you will need to register your device with it.  A device is considered any physical machine such as a desktop, laptop, tablet, or mobile phone. If you have multiple vaults on a machine, they will only be considered as 1 device.

searchDocs.title: License Types​
searchDocs.content: There are 2 types of licenses: Basic and Extended  Basic License​  The basic license can be used on up to 2 devices.  Extended License​  The extended license can be up on up to 5 devices.  Buy a license

searchDocs.title: Register your device​
searchDocs.content: In Obsidian, open SettingsClick Vault ExplorerUnder the Premium section, enter your license key received by email  Congratulations. Your device is now registered to that license

searchDocs.title: Unregister your device​
searchDocs.content: In Obsidian, open SettingsClick Vault ExplorerUnder the Premium section, click the Unregister device button

searchDocs.title: Page size​
searchDocs.content: The number of items to display per page.  102550100250500  warning Increasing the page size will cause longer render times and potential lag

searchDocs.title: Title wrapping​
searchDocs.content: Name	DescriptionNormal	Don't break words to make the title fit Break-word	Break words to make the text fit.  When Normal is selected, text that overflows will be truncated with ellipsis ...  Break-word is useful if you have long titles without spaces, such as timestamps or UUIDs.

searchDocs.title: Enable scroll buttons​
searchDocs.content: When enabled, scroll buttons will be displayed for scrollable content when scroll bars are hidden.  If you use the plugin on a device with touchscreen or you use a trackpad, it is recommended to disable this setting.

searchDocs.title: Filters​
searchDocs.content: All filters may be enabled or disabled.  When a filter is disabled, it will not be displayed above the view.

searchDocs.title: Views​
searchDocs.content: All views may be enabled or disabled.  When a view is disabled, it will not be displayed in the view tab list.  note Unimplemented views are disabled by default.

searchDocs.title: Favorite property​
searchDocs.content: The property used to mark a note as a favorite. This is used by the favorite filter.  note The setting dropdown only displays checkbox properties.

searchDocs.title: URL property​
searchDocs.content: The property used to store the URL of a file. When this setting has a property selected, a link button will appear for cards in the grid view  note The setting dropdown only displays text properties.

searchDocs.title: Modification date property​
searchDocs.content: The timestamp filter filters vault files based on their modification date. By default, the file system's modification date is used. If you prefer to use an Obsidian property, you can select it from the dropdown menu in this setting.  For example, if you have a file that uses the modification property name. You should choose modification from the dropdown list.  --- modification: 2020-01-01T23:00:00 ---   If the selected property does not exist for a file, the file system's modification date will be used. This applies to files such as images, videos, and PDFs.  note The setting dropdown only displays date or datetime properties.

searchDocs.title: Creation date property​
searchDocs.content: The timestamp filter filters vault files based on their creation date. By default, the file system's creation date is used. If you prefer to use an Obsidian property, you can select it from the dropdown menu in this setting.  For example, if you have a file that uses the creation property name. You should choose creation from the dropdown list.  --- creation: 2020-01-01T23:00:00 ---   If the selected property does not exist for a file, the file system's creation date will be used. This applies to files such as images, videos, and PDFs.  note The setting dropdown only displays date or datetime properties.

searchDocs.title: Custom Properties​
searchDocs.content: TODO

searchDocs.title: Enable clock updates​
searchDocs.content: The plugin will automatically update time values every minute, ensuring that the timestamp filter uses the most current time values. As a result, the Vault Explorer view will refresh every minute.  Disable this setting if you do not want the view to update every minute.

searchDocs.title: License key​
searchDocs.content: A license key is used to activate premium features on a device. Once you use a license key for a vault, you will have premium features activated on any other vaults that you use on the same device.  info If you use Obsidian sync, you will need to enter your license key on each device

searchDocs.title: Log level​
searchDocs.content: The log level will filter messages displayed in the developer console.  The level is set to Warn by default. This means that log messages at level Warn or Error will be displayed in the console.  If you want to see more log messages for debugging change the level to Debug or Trace.  When the log level is Off, no messages from the Vault Explorer plugin will appear in the console besides messages related to migration of settings on plugin startup.

searchDocs.title: Grid
searchDocs.content: Grid The grid view displays vault files as cards in a grid. The grid will expand to as many columns as the screen size allows.

searchDocs.title: List
searchDocs.content: List The list view displays vault files as minimalistic items in a list.

searchDocs.title: Installation​
searchDocs.content: If you haven't done so already, install the Vault Explorer plugin from the Obsidian plugin store.

searchDocs.title: Open the explorer view​
searchDocs.content: Open the explorer view by clicking on the compass button in the left sidebar.  You may also run Open vault explorer view from the command palette.

searchDocs.title: Change views​
searchDocs.content: Views are different visual formats for displaying your vault files. When you first open the explorer view, the Grid view is active.  To change to another view, click one of the view tabs.  Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Reorder view tabs​
searchDocs.content: To reorder the view tabs, drag one tab and drop it onto another tab.  Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Filter by favorites​
searchDocs.content: Filters allow you to control what is displayed in a view.  The favorite filter allows you to only display notes that contain a favorite property with a value of true.  Let's choose a property to use with the favorite filter.  Open the plugin settings by clicking the gear icon in the upper right cornerScroll down to the Built-in Properties sectionFind the Favorite property settingClick the dropdown and change the value from Select a property to the property that you want to use  If no properties are listed, please add a checkbox property to one of your notes. This property will then appear in the dropdown list.  Your browser does not support the video tag.      Now go to back to the explorer view, and click the favorites checkbox. The view will only display notes that have the selected favorite property with a value of true.  info The favorite filter is applied on top of other filters such as the timestamp filter or the custom filter.    Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Add a custom filter group​
searchDocs.content: The custom filter gives you granular control over what is displayed in a view. The custom filter is organized into filter groups and filter rules. A filter group can have many filter rules.  note The creation of this note is arbitrary. It is only used to showcase the custom filter feature.  Start by creating a note. Add a tags property with a test tag.  Your browser does not support the video tag.      Now add a filter group.  Click the button with 3 vertical dots (Change custom filter)    Click the button on the left with a plus (Add filter group)        You will see that a filter rule was added when the filter group was added.  Let's configure this rule.  Click the property type dropdown. Change it from text to list    Then, click the property name dropdown. Change it from select a property to tags    Enter test into the input field. You do not need to include a hash mark #.    Finally, click outside of the modal.    Click the filter group to enable it. With the filter group enabled, you will only see notes that have a tags property containing a test tag.  Click the filter group again to disable it.  Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Switch between filter groups​
searchDocs.content: Now let's add a few more filter groups.  Click the button with 3 vertical dots (Change custom filter)Click the button on the left with a plus (Add filter group) a few timesClick outside of the modal  Now click on a group to enable it. Any other active group will be disabled.    Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Reorder filter groups​
searchDocs.content: To reorder filter groups, drag one group and drop it onto another group.  Your browser does not support the video tag.      You may also reorder filter groups from within the custom filter modal.  Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Set a filter group as sticky​
searchDocs.content: A sticky group is a group that remains enabled even when another group becomes enabled.  Let's set our filter group as a sticky group.  Hold ctrl (Windows/Linux) or cmd (Mac)Click the first group to set it as a sticky group  Now click other groups to see that the sticky group remains enabled.  Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Set a filter group as normal​
searchDocs.content: Now let's set the sticky filter group as a normal group.  Hold ctrl (Windows/Linux) or cmd (Mac)Click the sticky group to set it as a normal group  Your browser does not support the video tag.

searchDocs.title: Congratulations​
searchDocs.content: Congratulations! You have just learned the basics of using the Vault Explorer plugin.

searchDocs.title: What's next?​
searchDocs.content: Learn about custom filter rule typesCheck out the feed viewLearn how to filter by tags in both frontmatter and content bodyLearn about Premium
